Politisi Gerindra Minta Anggaran Penanggulangan Kekeringan di Sampang Ditingkatkan
02 Nov 2019, 10:00 by Iswantoro


Politisi Gerindra Minta Anggaran Penanggulangan Kekeringan di Sampang Ditingkatkan

KBRN, Sampang : Salah satu anggota Badan Anggaran DPRD Sampang, Alan Kaisan meminta anggaran penanggulangan bencana kekeringan untu tahun 2020 harus ditingkatkan, minimal Rp 1 miliar. 
Alan menilai, penyaluran bantuan air bersih pada tahun 2019 untuk masyarakat yang terdampak kekeringan didaerahnya masih jauh dari kategori cukup. 
Politisi Partai Gerindra itu, mennyebutkan, pada tahun 2019, anggaran penanggulangan bencana kekeringan hanya Rp 150 juta,   itupun disalurkan kepada 67 desa dari 6 kecamatan yang mengalami kekeringan musiman, ketika di belikan air maka rata-rata setiap warga hanya menerima sekitar 2 liter air semusim kemarau sekitar 7 bulan. Pihaknya menilai ini sangat miris di tengah musim kemarau yang panjang pada tahun ini hanya dialokasikan anggaran Rp 150 juta dengan armada 3 tangki. 
“Maka saya meminta tahun anggaran 2020 harus dianggarkan minimal Rp.1 miliar dengan hitungan, 67 desa x rata-rata penduduk 2.000 jiwa = 134.000 jiwa, 134.000 jiwa x 100 liter air semusim = 13.400.000 liter air, lalu 13.400.000 dibagi 5.000 air pertangki =2.680, kemudian 2.680 x Rp. 300.000 pertangki sama dengan Rp. 804.000.000, sehingga dengan anggaran sebesar itu minimal meringankan bebam masayarakat kecil di pelosok desa. Karena bencana kekeringan adalah bencana luar biasa yang harus di atasi oleh pemerintah,” jelasnya, Sabtu (2/11/2019). 
Alan menambahkan, kedepan dalam perencanaan pengeboran dan pembangunan tandon harus di prioritaskan kepada desa yang memang mengalami kekeringan musiman, serta membangun embung sebagai tambahan penunjang.

Gerindra Politicians Ask for Increased Drought Mitigation Budget in Sampang
02 Nov 2019, 10:00 by Iswantoro


Gerindra Politicians Ask for Increased Drought Mitigation Budget in Sampang

KBRN, Sampang: One member of the Sampang DPRD Budget Board, Alan Kaisan, asks that the 2020 drought disaster budget be increased, a minimum of Rp 1 billion.
Alan assessed, the distribution of clean water assistance in 2019 for people affected by drought in their area is still far from enough categories.
The Gerindra Party politician said, in 2019, the drought disaster budget was only Rp 150 million, and even then it was distributed to 67 villages from 6 sub-districts experiencing seasonal drought. When bought with water, on average each citizen only received about 2 liters of seasonal water around 7 months dry. He said he felt this was very sad in the middle of the long dry season this year, with a budget of Rp 150 million allocated with a 3-tank fleet.
"So I ask for the 2020 fiscal year to be budgeted at least Rp.1 billion with a count, 67 villages x average population of 2,000 people = 134,000 inhabitants, 134,000 inhabitants x 100 liters of seasonal water = 13,400,000 liters of water, then 13,400,000 divided by 5,000 water tank = 2,680, then 2,680 x Rp. 300,000 per tank is equal to Rp. 804,000,000, so with a budget of that magnitude it minimizes the burden of small communities in remote villages. Because drought is an extraordinary disaster that must be overcome by the government, "he explained, Saturday (11/02/2019).
Alan added, in the future in the planning of drilling and reservoir construction should be prioritized to villages that are experiencing seasonal drought, and build reservoirs as additional support.
